TopicTitle: Fanwork Friday: Inspiring The Next Generation

Articles.Content: Thane Brimhall sent in his entry for the Kerbal Countdown on Twitter, and it is nothing short of heart warming and inspiring. With a boost like this we think he has a very lucky child that can grow up to accomplish many great things! Who or what inspired you to take an interest in KSP?

That is awesome. I would buy that for my nephew.

I had my copy of When We Left Earth over at his house and everytime they would show a picture of a launch he would point at the screen and yell "Rocket!". (Keep in mind he is 2.5 years old) So then I started playing KSP, same thing. Every time I launched, he was so fascinated.

Those little hands are going to shape our future. Let's get them inspired now! I live an hour away from Kennedy Space Center and I love taking my boys, 6 and 12 there. Especially for the Shuttle Launch Experience and the shop. But if I were completely honest, I'd go by myself any day and be like a kid in a candy store. Was fortunate enough to witness the STS-131 launch before they cut the program.
